CatDescriptText: Evers Lang, hospital cook, 1900 Beaver Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that it is all right to present such religious take-offs as entertainment. That is, they are like 'Green Pastures.'  In my opinion, the program was a good lesson of the Bible.  However, I might add that I did not see the entire program."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evers Lang wearing wool overcoat, light colored shirt with top button fastened, and bent fedora, posed in front of park
